name: Diane Kelly-Riley
bio: Diane Kelly-Riley is the project director of Company Town Legacy.  She is Associate Professor of English.

name: Gary Strong
bio: Gary Strong is Vice President of the Potlatch Historical Society;  he is also UCLA University Librarian Emeritus; former state of California Librarian; and founder of the UCLA International Digital Ephemera Project. His family homesteaded north of Potlatch, Idaho.

name: Karen Rohn
affiliation: Return to Riverside Music Festival and the Potlatch Historical Society
bio: Karen Rohn is Executive Director of the Return to Riverside Music Festival and is President of the Potlatch Historical Society

name: Evan Williamson
bio: Working with the Center for Digital Inquiry and Learning (CDIL), Evan develops digital scholarship projects on the web.

name: Idaho Humanities Council
bio: Idaho Humanities Council generously provided the funding to collect the Riverside Oral Histories

name: J. Lyon
bio: A writer and researcher who transcends time and space in writing and in life. Driven by nature and history.

name: Margaret "Meagan" Myberg
bio: Meagan Myrberg lives in Coeur d'Alene and works at the Coeur d'Alene Public Library. She is finishing up her undergraduate work in English (Professional Writing) at the University of Idaho, and hopes to further her education in library science.

name: Makendra Patzer
bio: Makendra Patzer is a student at the University of Idaho. She has lived in North Idaho her entire life and has a passion for the history of the area.

name: Mary Phipps
bio: Mary Phipps has a degree in journalism from the University of Idaho and has a personal connect with the Idaho logging industry through several close family members.

name: Charlie Wilson
bio: Charlie Wilson is the creator of the podcast "Potlatch Stories" and is a former history teacher at Potlatch High School.
